answers.text: a mummy of a neolithic body

qas.question: When was Otzi the Iceman found?
Where was Otzi the Iceman discovered?

context: <a1_0>In 1991<a1_0/> <a0_0>a mummy of a neolithic body<a0_0/>, known as Ötzi the Iceman, was discovered by hikers on <a2_0>the Similaun glacier<a2_0/>. His clothing and gear indicate that he lived in an alpine farming community, while the location and manner of his death - an arrowhead was discovered in his shoulder - suggests he was travelling from one place to another. Analysis of the mitochondrial DNA of Ötzi, has shown that he belongs to the K1 subclade which cannot be categorized into any of the three modern branches of that subclade. The new subclade has provisionally been named K1ö for Ötzi.
